Sentence.sentence: These designers established the modem dress code, letting playsuits and other activewear outfits suffice for casual clothing, allowing pants to enter the wardrobe, and prizing rationalism and versatility in dress, in contradiction to dressing for an occasion or allotment of the day.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"让，允许"之意。
means: allow ：普通用词，侧重听任、默许或不加阻止。在正式场合可用来表客气的请求。
let ：常用词，用于各种非正式场合，语气最弱，指允许或无力阻止某事，暗示漠不关心或听之任之。
permit ：正式用词，在多数场合可与allow换用，语义最强，指准许某人做某事，含权威或正式的意味。
leave ：侧重不加干涉。
authorize ：语气最强，指权威性的允许与认可。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"租，租用"之意。
means: hire ： 多指短期租用。在英国一般指租用车、船。
lease ： 指按照租约租出或租用房屋、土地或其它不动产。
rent ： 在英国指较长时间租出或租入房屋、商店或土地；而在美国指长时间或短时期租用各种资产以及日用东西。
let ： 尤指出租房屋或地产等。
charter ： 指承租大型运输工具，如飞机、轮船、大客车以及火车等。

sentences.en: They let fly a shower of arrows.

sentences.en: His father doesn't let him smoke.
sentences.cn: 他父亲不允许他吸烟。

sentences.en: We mustn't let slip such an opportunity.
sentences.cn: 这样的机会我们不能错过。

means.word_mean: （提出请求或布置任务时说）要
（表示不害怕或担忧某人做某事）让
让…经过(或来、去)；允许…通过

sentences.en: The secretary let me into the office.
sentences.cn: 秘书让我进了办公室。

sentences.en: Let the water from the tank.
sentences.cn: 把水柜里的水放出来。

sentences.en: We're hoping to let this field.
sentences.cn: 我们希望把这块地租出去。

sentences.en: Mrs. Brown let me a room.
sentences.cn: 布朗夫人租给我一间房。

sentences.en: They let rooms to college students.
sentences.cn: 他们向大学生出租房间。

fixed_phrase_list.cn: 更不用说；更别提；不打扰

sentence.cn: 在我结束之前，请允许我给您一些建议，这会让您的逗留更加愉快。
sentence.en: Before I finish,  let me just give you some advice which should make your stay more enjoyable.

sentence.cn: 好的，但是让我先完成化学作业。
sentence.en: Okay,  but let me finish my chemistry homework first.

expand_knowledge_list.cn: 让我一个人呆一会儿吧。

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause to come down gradually; lower
jx.jx_cn_mean: 放下，降下：使其逐渐下来；降低

jx.jx_en_mean: To withdraw support from; forsake.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使失望：没有达到所期望的；使沮丧

jx.jx_en_mean: To allow to be known; admit

lj.lj_ly: Don't let on that you know me.
lj.lj_ls: 不要让人知道你认识我

jx.jx_en_mean: To pretend.
To come to a close; end

lj.lj_ly: School let out early. The play let out at 11&b{p.m.}
lj.lj_ls: 学校放学早。话剧&b{晚上} 11点结束

jx.jx_en_mean: To make known; reveal
To increase the size of (a garment, for example)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 放大（衣服）：增大（例如衣服的）尺寸

jx.jx_en_mean: To slow down; diminish

lj.lj_ly: didn't let up in their efforts.

jx.jx_en_mean: To come to a stop; cease
stop disturbing or interfering with

lj.lj_ly: let him be—he knows what he wants.
lj.lj_ls: 随他去吧——他知道自己要做什么。

jx.jx_en_mean: seek to give someone bad news in a way that avoids causing them too much distress or humiliation
casually reveal a piece of information
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无意中说出，不经意透露

lj.lj_ly: from the things he let drop I think there was a woman in his life.
lj.lj_ls: 从他随口说出的话里，我听出他身边有一个女人。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Geometry)draw (a perpendicular) from an outside point to a line
attack, either physically or verbally
jx.jx_cn_mean: 对…进行（身体或语言）攻击

lj.lj_ly: the troops let fly with shells loaded with chemical weapons.
lj.lj_ls: 军队用化学武器炮弹进行攻击。

jx.jx_en_mean: act in an unrestrained or uninhibited way

lj.lj_ly: you need to unwind and let yourself go.
lj.lj_ls: 你该放松下来，干点自己想干的事。

jx.jx_en_mean: become careless or untidy in one's habits or appearance

lj.lj_ly: he's really let himself go since my mother died.
lj.lj_ls: 自从妈妈去世之后，他变得越来越邋遢。

jx.jx_en_mean: allow someone or something to escape or go free
(亦作 let go 或 let go of)relinquish one's grip on someone or something

lj.lj_ly: Adam let go of the reins.
you must let the past go.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)attack someone physically or verbally

lj.lj_ly: I really let him have it for worrying me so much.
lj.lj_ls: 他老是烦我，我好好教训了他一顿。

jx.jx_en_mean: engage (or release) the clutch of a vehicle by releasing pressure on (or applying it to) the clutch pedal

entry.def: If you let something happen, you allow it to happen without doing anything to stop or prevent it.

example.ex: People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals die...
example.tran: 人们说我们是在干涉自然界，还说我们应该任由动物死去。

example.ex: Thorne let him talk...
example.tran: 索恩让他畅所欲言。

entry.def: If you let someone do something, you give them your permission to do it.
entry.tran: 允许，准许，同意（某人做某事）

example.ex: I love sweets but Mum doesn't let me have them very often...
example.tran: 我爱吃糖，可妈妈不让我常吃。

example.ex: The Americans won't let her leave the country...
example.tran: 美国人不允许她出境。

entry.def: If you let someone into, out of, or through a place, you allow them to enter, leave, or go through it, for example by opening a door or making room for them.
entry.tran: （开门、让路等）允许（…进、出或通过）

example.ex: I had to get up at seven o'clock this morning to let them into the building because they had lost their keys...
example.tran: 今天早上我不得不7点钟就起床开门让他们进楼，因为他们把钥匙弄丢了。

example.ex: I let myself into the flat...
example.tran: 我自己开门进了公寓。

entry.def: You use let me when you are introducing something you want to say.
entry.tran: （用于引出要说的话）让我，我来

example.ex: Let me say it again. I despised Wade's life...
example.tran: 我再说一遍。我厌恶韦德的生活方式。

example.ex: Let me tell you what I saw last night...
example.tran: 我来告诉你我昨晚见到了什么。

entry.def: You use let me when you are offering politely to do something.
entry.tran: （用于礼貌地表示愿意提供帮助）让我，我来

example.ex: Let me take your coat...
example.tran: 我来帮您拿外套。

example.ex: Let me get you something to drink.
example.tran: 我给你拿杯喝的来。

entry.def: You say let's or, in more formal English, let us, to direct the attention of the people you are talking to towards the subject that you want to consider next.
entry.tran: （用于将他人的注意力引向下面的话题）让我们

example.ex: Let's consider ways of making it easier...
example.tran: 咱们来想想办法把它变得更容易些吧。

example.ex: Let us look at these views in more detail.
example.tran: 我们来具体研究一下这些观点。

entry.def: You say let's or, in formal English, let us, when you are making a suggestion that involves both you and the person you are talking to, or when you are agreeing to a suggestion of this kind.
entry.tran: （用于提出建议或表示赞同）让我们

example.ex: I'm bored. Let's go home...
example.tran: 我觉得好无聊。我们回家吧。

example.ex: 'Shall we go in and have some supper?' — 'Yes, let's.'
example.tran: “我们要不要进去吃点晚饭？”——“好啊，走吧。”

entry.def: Someone in authority, such as a teacher, can use let's or, in more formal English, let us, in order to give a polite instruction to another person or group of people.
entry.tran: （用于委婉地发出指令）让我们

example.ex: Let's have some hush, please...
example.tran: 请大家安静一下。

example.ex: 'Let us pray,' said the Methodist chaplain.
example.tran: “我们来祈祷吧，”那个循道宗牧师说。

entry.def: People often use let in expressions such as let me see or let me think when they are hesitating or thinking of what to say next.
entry.tran: （表示犹豫或思考）让我看看/让我想想

example.ex: Now, let's see. Where did I leave my bag?...
example.tran: 嗯，我想想。我把包放哪儿了？

example.ex: 'How long you been living together then?' — 'Erm, let me think. It's about four years now.'
example.tran: “那你们住在一起有多久了？”——“呃，我想想。到现在差不多4年了。”

entry.def: You can use let to say that you do not care if someone does something, although you think it is unpleasant or wrong.

example.ex: If he wants to do that, let him do it...
example.tran: 他要做，就让他做好了。

example.ex: Let them talk about me; I'll be dead, anyway...
example.tran: 随他们怎么说我吧；我反正是要死的。

entry.def: You can use let when you are saying what you think someone should do, usually when they are behaving in a way that you think is unreasonable or wrong.
entry.tran: （表示认为某人应该做某事）让

example.ex: Let him get his own cup of tea...
example.tran: 自己的茶让他自己端。

example.ex: If they value these data, let them pay for them.
example.tran: 他们要是看重这些数据，就让他们出钱买。

entry.def: You can use let when you are praying or hoping very much that something will happen.

example.ex: Please God, let him telephone me.
example.tran: 上帝啊，求你让他打电话给我吧。

entry.def: You can use let to introduce an assumption on which you are going to base a theory, calculation, or story.

example.ex: Let x equal 5 and y equal 3...
example.tran: 设x等于5，y等于3。

example.ex: The new man in my life (let's call him Dave) had a very jealous ex-girlfriend.
example.tran: 我生命中这个新男人（就叫他戴夫吧），他的前女友是个醋坛子。

entry.def: If you let your house or land to someone, you allow them to use it in exchange for money that they pay you regularly.

example.ex: She is thinking of letting her house to an American serviceman...
example.tran: 她正考虑把房子租给一个美国军人。

example.ex: The reasons for letting a house, or part of one, are varied.
example.tran: 把整套房子或其中一部分租出去，其原因是多种多样的。

entry.def: In tennis or badminton, if you serve a let, the ball or shuttlecock touches the net but lands in the correct part of the court. You then serve again.
entry.tran: （网球或羽毛球发球时的）擦网球，触网重发

entry.def: Let alone is used after a statement, usually a negative one, to indicate that the statement is even more true of the person, thing, or situation that you are going to mention next.
entry.tran: （通常用在否定句后）遑论，更别提，更不用说

example.ex: It is incredible that the 12-year-old managed to even reach the pedals, let alone drive the car.
example.tran: 12岁的孩子能踩到踏板已经是不可思议，就更不用说开车了。

entry.def: To let someone be means to leave them alone and not interfere in what they are doing.

example.ex: If your child is really sick and needs sleep and quiet, let him be.
example.tran: 如果孩子真的病了，需要睡眠和静养的话，就不要去打扰他。

entry.def: If you let go of someone or something, you stop holding them.

example.ex: She let go of Mona's hand and took a sip of her drink...
example.tran: 她放开莫娜的手，抿了一口饮料。

example.ex: She held the photos with the determined grip of a small child and wouldn't  let go.
example.tran: 她像小孩一样紧紧攥住那些照片，不肯放手。

entry.def: If you let go of a feeling, attitude, or the control that you have over something, you accept that you should give it up or that it should no longer influence you.
entry.tran: 放弃，舍弃（感情、态度、控制权）

example.ex: In therapy, she began to let go of her obsession with Mike...
example.tran: 在心理治疗中，她开始逐渐放下对麦克的痴迷。

example.ex: The work should focus on helping parents to let go of their children.
example.tran: 工作应以协助父母放松对子女的管教为重点。

entry.def: If you let someone or something go, you allow them to leave or escape.

example.ex: They held him for three hours and they let him go...
example.tran: 他们扣留了他3个小时后放走了他。

example.ex: I'm quite happy really to net a fish and then let it go.
example.tran: 网到鱼后又把它放生，我挺开心的。

entry.def: When someone leaves a job, either because they are told to or because they want to, the employer sometimes says that they are letting that person go .

example.ex: I've assured him I have no plans to let him go...
example.tran: 我向他保证，我绝对没打算让他走人。

example.ex: Peterson was let go after less than two years.
example.tran: 不到两年彼得森就被解雇了。

entry.def: If someone says or does something that you think is annoying or stupid and you let it go, you do not react to it or say anything about it.

example.ex: Let it go, he thought. He didn't feel like arguing.
example.tran: 管它呢，他想。他并不想争吵。

entry.def: If you let yourself go, you relax and behave much more freely than usual.

example.ex: Stop worrying about what you're feeling. Let yourself go.
example.tran: 不要总想着自己是什么感觉。放轻松点。

entry.def: If someone lets themselves go, they pay less attention to themselves or their appearance than they used to, so that they look untidy or unattractive.

example.ex: If you have let yourself go, you should consider doing something about it for the sake of your health.
example.tran: 你以前要是对自己不管不顾，现在应该为了自己的健康着想而改变一下。

entry.def: If you say that you did not know what you were letting yourself in for when you decided to do something, you mean you did not realize how difficult, unpleasant, or expensive it was going to be.
entry.tran: (使自己)陷入，卷入，招惹（麻烦等）

example.ex: He got the impression that Miss Hawes had no idea of what she was letting herself in for...
example.tran: 他觉得霍斯小姐根本不知道自己会惹来什么麻烦。

example.ex: I realized I'd let myself in for something from which there was no turning back.
example.tran: 我意识到自己陷入了没有退路的境地。

entry.def: If you let someone know something, you tell them about it or make sure that they know about it.

example.ex: They want to let them know that they are safe...
example.tran: 他们想让他们知道他们安全无事。

example.ex: If you do want to go, please let me know.
example.tran: 如果你真想去的话就请告诉我。

entry.def: If you let drop ,let fall, or let slip information, you reveal it casually or by accident, during a conversation about something else.

example.ex: How could she know about that? He'd certainly never let drop any hint...
example.tran: 她是怎么知道的？他绝对没有走漏半点风声。

example.ex: He might have let something slip in a moment of weakness.
example.tran: 他可能一时大意说漏了嘴。

entry.def: If you say that someone has been let loose in a place or situation, you mean that they have been given complete freedom to do what they like in that place or situation, and you suggest that this may be risky.

example.ex: She has all the glee of a little girl let loose in a sweetie shop...
example.tran: 她像糖果店里无人管束的小女孩那样兴高采烈。

example.ex: Trainees go through a four-hour lesson before they are let loose on the controls.
example.tran: 受训人员须上4小时的课才能自由进行操作。

entry.def: If someone lets loose a sound or remark, they make it, often suddenly.

example.ex: He let loose a long, deep sigh...
example.tran: 他突然喟然长叹了一声。

example.ex: Hill let loose a torrent of abuse against those who prosecuted his case.
example.tran: 希尔对控告他的人破口大骂起来。

entry.def: If something lets you down, it is the reason you are not as successful as you could have been.
entry.tran: 使美中不足；使差强人意；使不理想

example.ex: Many believe it was his shyness and insecurity which let him down...
example.tran: 很多人认为是他的腼腆和缺乏安全感拖了他的后腿。

example.ex: Sadly, the film is let down by an excessively simple plot.
example.tran: 遗憾的是，过于简单的情节使得这部电影差强人意。

entry.def: If you let down something such as a tyre, you allow air to escape from it.

example.ex: I let the tyres down on his car...
example.tran: 我把他的汽车轮胎放了气。

example.ex: Remove wheelnuts, let down tyre, put on spare.
example.tran: 拧下车轮螺母，放掉车胎的气，换上备用胎。

means.word_mean: 1. a serve that strikes the net before falling into the receiver's court; the ball must be served again
1. make it possible through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen;

sentences.sentence: "This permits the water to rush in"
"This sealed door won't allow the water come into the basement"
"This will permit the rain to run off"
"I let it be known that I was not interested"
"She permitted her son to visit her estranged husband"
"I won't let the police search her basement"
"I cannot allow you to see your exam"

means.word_mean: 4. cause to move; cause to be in a certain position or condition;

sentences.sentence: "He got his squad on the ball"
"This let me in for a big surprise"

means.word_mean: 6. grant use or occupation of under a term of contract;

sentences.sentence: "I am leasing my country estate to some foreigners"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lǣtan 'leave behind, leave out', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch laten and German lassen, also to late
Old English lettan 'hinder', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch letten, also to late

means: 允许
许可
让
要
假设
出租
擦网球
出租
Linear Energy Transfer 能量线性传递
允许；让,准许；许可；同意,允许（去某处）,（提出建议时说）,（提出帮助时说）让，由,（提出请求或布置任务时说）要,（表示不害怕或担忧某人做某事）让,（表达强烈的愿望）让,（引出要讲或要做的事）让,（计算时说）假设，设,出租（房屋、房间等）
（发球时的）擦网球,出租；租借
Lettish 列托人的，列托语的，列托语（拉脱维亚）
允许；让，准许；许可；同意，允许（去某处），（提出建议时说），（提出帮助时说）让，由，（提出请求或布置任务时说）要，（表示不害怕或担忧某人做某事）让，（表达强烈的愿望）让，（引出要讲或要做的事）让，（计算时说）假设，设，出租（房屋、房间等）
（发球时的）擦网球，出租；租借

sentences.cn: 人们说我们是在干涉自然界，还说我们应该任由动物死去。
sentences.en: People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals die...

sentences.cn: 索恩让他畅所欲言。
sentences.en: Thorne let him talk...

sentences.cn: 我爱吃糖，可妈妈不让我常吃。
sentences.en: I love sweets but Mum doesn't let me have them very often...

sentences.cn: 美国人不允许她出境。
sentences.en: The Americans won't let her leave the country...

sentences.cn: 今天早上我不得不7点钟就起床开门让他们进楼，因为他们把钥匙弄丢了。
sentences.en: I had to get up at seven o'clock this morning to let them into the building because they had lost their keys...

sentences.cn: 我自己开门进了公寓。
sentences.en: I let myself into the flat...

sentences.cn: 我再说一遍。我厌恶韦德的生活方式。
sentences.en: Let me say it again. I despised Wade's life...

sentences.cn: 我来告诉你我昨晚见到了什么。
sentences.en: Let me tell you what I saw last night...

sentences.cn: 我来帮您拿外套。
sentences.en: Let me take your coat...

sentences.cn: 我给你拿杯喝的来。
sentences.en: Let me get you something to drink.

sentences.cn: 咱们来想想办法把它变得更容易些吧。
sentences.en: Let's consider ways of making it easier...

sentences.cn: 我们来具体研究一下这些观点。
sentences.en: Let us look at these views in more detail.

sentences.cn: 我觉得好无聊。我们回家吧。
sentences.en: I'm bored. Let's go home...

sentences.cn: “我们要不要进去吃点晚饭？”——“好啊，走吧。”
sentences.en: 'Shall we go in and have some supper?' — 'Yes, let's.'

sentences.cn: 请大家安静一下。
sentences.en: Let's have some hush, please...

sentences.cn: “我们来祈祷吧，”那个循道宗牧师说。
sentences.en: 'Let us pray,' said the Methodist chaplain.

sentences.cn: 嗯，我想想。我把包放哪儿了？
sentences.en: Now, let's see. Where did I leave my bag?...

sentences.cn: “那你们住在一起有多久了？”——“呃，我想想。到现在差不多4年了。”
sentences.en: 'How long you been living together then?' — 'Erm, let me think. It's about four years now.'

sentences.cn: 他要做，就让他做好了。
sentences.en: If he wants to do that, let him do it...

sentences.cn: 随他们怎么说我吧；我反正是要死的。
sentences.en: Let them talk about me; I'll be dead, anyway...

sentences.cn: 自己的茶让他自己端。
sentences.en: Let him get his own cup of tea...

sentences.cn: 他们要是看重这些数据，就让他们出钱买。
sentences.en: If they value these data, let them pay for them.

sentences.cn: 上帝啊，求你让他打电话给我吧。
sentences.en: Please God, let him telephone me.

sentences.cn: 设x等于5，y等于3。
sentences.en: Let x equal 5 and y equal 3...

sentences.cn: 我生命中这个新男人（就叫他戴夫吧），他的前女友是个醋坛子。
sentences.en: The new man in my life (let's call him Dave) had a very jealous ex-girlfriend.

sentences.cn: 她正考虑把房子租给一个美国军人。
sentences.en: She is thinking of letting her house to an American serviceman...

sentences.cn: 把整套房子或其中一部分租出去，其原因是多种多样的。
sentences.en: The reasons for letting a house, or part of one, are varied.

sentences.cn: 12岁的孩子能踩到踏板已经是不可思议，就更不用说开车了。
sentences.en: It is incredible that the 12-year-old managed to even reach the pedals, let alone drive the car.

sentences.cn: 如果孩子真的病了，需要睡眠和静养的话，就不要去打扰他。
sentences.en: If your child is really sick and needs sleep and quiet, let him be.

sentences.cn: 她放开莫娜的手，抿了一口饮料。
sentences.en: She let go of Mona's hand and took a sip of her drink...

sentences.cn: 允许某人进屋
sentences.en: to let sb into the house

sentences.cn: 美国人不允许她出境。
sentences.en: The Americans won't let her leave the country...

sentences.cn: 另一种建议是，允许学生在法学院学习两年后就参加律师资格考试。
sentences.en: Another is to let students sit for the bar after only two years of law  school.

sentences.cn: 请允许我自我介绍一下. 我叫约翰·布朗,是来自加拿大的商人.
sentences.en: Please let me introduce myself. My name is John Brown . Ia businessman from Canada.

sentences.cn: 所以首先允许我说你可以去宽恕别人,这不是一件蠢事.
sentences.en: So let me first say that you can forgive and still not be a chump.

sentences.cn: 宝贵地球轨道资源,不允许这种事发生.
sentences.en: The orbits around the Earth are too valuable to let this happen.

sentences.cn: 我绝不允许那个摄影师给我们刚出生的宝宝拍照片.
sentences.en: I would not let the photographer take a picture of our newborn baby.

sentences.cn: 请允许我借此机会宣布我提前退休.
sentences.en: Let me take this opportunity to announce my early retirement.

sentences.cn: 他不允许任何人挡他的道.
sentences.en: He could not let anyone stand in the way of the mission.

sentences.cn: 我不能指名道姓. 你的关于诽谤的法律不允许我那样.
sentences.en: I can't name them. Your libel laws won't let me.

sentences.cn: 没有任何人能侮辱我们、困拢我们,除非我们自己允许.
sentences.en: No one can humiliate or disturb us unless we let him.

sentences.cn: 她允许他不做家庭作业,因为他病了.
sentences.en: She let him off doing his homework because he was ill.

sentences.cn: 即使是非常小的事情,这种类型的经理都决不允许在没有她的批准下发生.
sentences.en: This type of manager won't let anything happen without her approval, no matter how small.

sentences.cn: 信用卡允许人们现在买东西,然后几个月或者几年以后付款.
sentences.en: Credit cards let people buy things now and pay for them over months or even years.

sentences.cn: 但在那之前, 请允许我来提醒大家一些关于iPhone的事情.
sentences.en: Before that, let me remind you of where we're at with theiPhone.

sentences.cn: 请允许我直言不讳: 我们知道有些人对未来小心翼翼.
sentences.en: Let us be honest: We know that some are wary of the future.

sentences.cn: 她允许她的孩子在街上玩.
sentences.en: She lets her children play in the street.

sentences.cn: 她恨不得从他们的包围中逃走, 可是她的自尊心又不允许她这样做.
sentences.en: She wanted desperately to flee from them, but her pride would not let her.

sentences.cn: 他父亲不允许他吸烟.
sentences.en: His father doesn't let him smoke.

sentences.cn: 请允许我提议为您的晋升干杯.
sentences.en: Let me propose a toast to your promotion.

sentences.cn: 请允许我向您表示祝贺.
sentences.en: Let me congratulate you.

sentences.cn: 我很高兴我将被允许出一半的票价参加音乐会.
sentences.en: I am glad that I shall be let into the concert for half price.

sentences.cn: 这些函数也允许你给一个目标IP指定一个网关.
sentences.en: These routines also let you associate a destination IP address with a specific gateway.

sentences.cn: 我父亲刚动过手术,医生还不允许我去看他.
sentences.en: My father's only just had his operation and they won't let me see him yet.

sentences.cn: 她爱他,娇养他,而且除了她自己以外,她不允许任何人管教他.
sentences.en: She petted and pampered him and would let no one discipline him but she, herself.

sentences.cn: 单元格样式可以进行分层并由多个元素共享, 从而允许重用代码.
sentences.en: Cell styles can be layered and shared by multiple elements, letting you reuse code.

sentences.cn: 让我再说一次: 天才是被允许凌驾于道德至上的.
sentences.en: Schwarz: Let me say it one more time: The genius was allowed to be above morality.

sentences.cn: 她竟允许那些孩子轻蔑地对待她!
sentences.en: She lets those children walk over her!

sentences.cn: 气缸壁较低位置的孔允许燃料和空气的混合气体进入.
sentences.en: A hole in the lower part of the cylinder wall lets in gas and air.

sentences.cn: 罗马天主教会规定,牧师必须保持独身,不允许结婚.
sentences.en: The Roman Catholic Church insists priests remain celibate and has ruled out letting them marry.

sentences.cn: 人们说我们是在干涉自然界，还说我们应该任由动物死去。
sentences.en: People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals die...

sentences.cn: 舍姆森在伤口上涂了厚厚一层,然后任由空罐子沉向港口的水底.
sentences.en: Shemsen slathered his wounds and let the emptied jar sink to the harbor bottom.

sentences.cn: 可是, 我如何能放纵自己,任由自己的思绪飞奔?
sentences.en: However, how can I indulge themselves and let their thoughts dash?

sentences.cn: 世事难料变化无常, 就象你现在坐在我的怀里,任由我施为一样.
sentences.en: Shishinanliao volatile, as you are sitting in my arms and let me SHI the same.

sentences.cn: 我宁可尽早这么做, 不要无限期任由搁置.
sentences.en: I would rather do so asas possible, not let on hold indefinitely.

sentences.cn: 但他筋疲力尽了,不再驱赶鲨鱼, 任由鲨鱼啃噬他的大鱼.
sentences.en: But he tired and will not drive away sharks, sharks Kenshi let his big fish.

sentences.cn: 《草叶集》是不会被删改的, 任由它自己繁荣和枯萎吧!
sentences.en: The Leaves of Grass won't be censored , just let it be rich or scorch naturally.

sentences.cn: 任由旋风哀唱其挽歌.
sentences.en: Let the whirlwind mourn its requiem.

sentences.cn: 我只是演奏,任由音乐带著我.
sentences.en: I just played and let it take me away.

sentences.cn: 我们不能任由粤剧艺术日渐凋零.
sentences.en: We can't let the art of Cantonese opera wither away.

sentences.cn: 当他任由门砰地一声在她面前关上时, 她讥讽地说:[真好啊!
sentences.en: How kind of you, she said sarcastically when he let the door slam in her face.

sentences.cn: 我闭上眼睛, 任由女儿的音乐牵引我的思绪.
sentences.en: I closed my eyes, letting myself be carried away by my daughter's song.

sentences.cn: 抑或,任由犯错误的国家违约, 从而强化货币信誉, 但由此削弱欧元区的凝聚力?
sentences.en: Or is it to let sinners default, thereby strengthening monetary credibility, but weakening cohesion?

sentences.cn: 我不会任由一群长舌女子令你苦恼.
sentences.en: I wouldn't let a bunch of gossipy girls make you miserable.

sentences.cn: 我可不打算任由他欺负。
sentences.en: I wasn't going to let him bully me.

sentences.cn: 他不会袖手旁观任由他最看好的项目被扼杀。
sentences.en: He would not stand by and let his pet project be killed off.

sentences.cn: 人们说我们是在干涉自然界，还说我们应该任由动物死去。
sentences.en: People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals die.

sentences.cn: 让我问你一个假设的问题.
sentences.en: Let me put a hypothetical question to you.

sentences.cn: 让我们假设一个我们不同意的状况.
sentences.en: Let us imagine a hypothetical case where we disagree.

sentences.cn: 诸兄弟, 让我们假设你或我将变成脱离了躯壳的自由精灵.
sentences.en: Let us suppose that you or i, brethren, shall become a free and disembody spirit.

sentences.cn: 让咱们假设唯一咱们不相同意的状况.
sentences.en: Lets imagine a hypothetical case wITe we disagree.

sentences.cn: 假设你就在事故现场.
sentences.en: Let you be on spot of the accident.

sentences.cn: 我们假设我们修改了一个文件,其当前版本是4.
sentences.en: Let us suppose that we are editing a file which is currently at version 4.

sentences.cn: 让我们假设一个小孩子突然在你前面穿过马路.
sentences.en: Let us suppose that a child suddenly crosses the road in front of you.

sentences.cn: 假设abc为45度角.
sentences.en: Let aBC Be an angle of 45 degrees.

sentences.cn: 我们假设为此选定的商品是面包 、 牛奶和肉类.
sentences.en: Let us say that the items chosen for this purpose are bread, milk and meat.

sentences.cn: 让我们假设你或我, 众兄弟, 都即将变成一个自由的、无缥缈的神灵.
sentences.en: Let us suppose that you or I, brethren, should become a free and disembodied spirit.

sentences.cn: 让我们假设每一个人, 比如你, 都希望使用那间最少被光顾的隔间.
sentences.en: Let us assume that everyone, like you, wishes to use the stall less travelled.

sentences.cn: 让我们假设所有公司董事的报销清单都公诸于世.
sentences.en: Let us suppose that all company directors'expense forms were made public.

sentences.cn: 假设AB等于CD.
sentences.en: Let AB be equal to CD.

sentences.cn: 现在我们假设当我和你谈话时你很生气.
sentences.en: But , let us suppose you angry over what I tell you.

sentences.cn: 让我们考查一下完全竞争理论的主流假设.
sentences.en: Let us examine the main assumptions of the theory of perfect competition.

sentences.cn: 假设这两条线平行.
sentences.en: Let the two lines be parallel.

sentences.cn: 人们假设这两个金发碧眼的人有亲戚关系, 所以他们就让这个假设成立.
sentences.en: People assume the two blonds are related, so they let that assumption stand.

sentences.cn: 我们假设这消息是正确的.
sentences.en: Let us suppose ( that ) the news is true.

sentences.cn: 让我们重新梳理一下这个假设的两难困境.
sentences.en: Let us run through this supposed dilemma again.

sentences.cn: 假设ABC为90度的角.
sentences.en: Let ABC be an angle of ninety degrees.

sentences.cn: 咱们姑且假设这个消息是真的.
sentences.en: Let us suppose for a moment that the news is really true.

sentences.cn: 为简便起见, 我们假设它正好是等摩尔混合的.
sentences.en: For simplicity, let us assure an exactly equimolar mixture.

sentences.cn: 我们不防假设它是可以改变的.
sentences.en: Let us pretend that it can be changed.

sentences.cn: 假设AB线与XY线相等.
sentences.en: Let the line AB be equal to the line XY.

sentences.cn: 我把那间空房出租了。
sentences.en: I let the spare room.

sentences.cn: 长期 / 短期出租
sentences.en: a long-term/short-term let

sentences.cn: 为了节省时间, 让我们在去机场的出租车上继续讨论.
sentences.en: To save time, let us continue the discussion in the taxi to the airport.

sentences.cn: 请查一下分类广告,看看威尔士地区是否有出租的家舍.
sentences.en: Look in the small ads to see if there are cottages to let in Wales.

sentences.cn: 公墓出租给死者的租金在上升.
sentences.en: The God's acre let out to the dead per square foot is rising.

sentences.cn: 他按日出租车辆.
sentences.en: He lets out cars by the day.

sentences.cn: 他们向大学生出租房间.
sentences.en: They let rooms to college students.

sentences.cn: 农业机器按周出租.
sentences.en: Farm machinery is let out by the week.

sentences.cn: 这幢维多利亚式的五层大楼按套间出租了.
sentences.en: The five floors of this large Victorian house were let off as separate flats.

sentences.cn: 房间出租, 洗衣不另收费.
sentences.en: Room to let, laundry found.

sentences.cn: 我把多馀的房间出租 ( 给房客 ).
sentences.en: I let ( out ) my spare rooms ( to lodgers ).

sentences.cn: 那公寓房子以每月五百美元出租.
sentences.en: That apartment lets for $ 500 a month.

sentences.cn: 驴子的主人坚持说他仅出租驴子本身, 不出租驴子的影子.
sentences.en: D owner insisted that he only letting ds themselves, not the shadow of letting ds.

sentences.cn: 这房子要出租或出售.
sentences.en: This house is to be let or sold.

sentences.cn: 房子要出租.
sentences.en: The house to let.

sentences.cn: 这所房子只出租, 不出售.
sentences.en: The house is to let, not to be sold.

sentences.cn: 他惯常按日出租汽车.
sentences.en: He used to let out cars by the day.

sentences.cn: 该公寓按年出租.
sentences.en: The apartment lets on a yearly basis.

sentences.cn: 我们叫辆出租汽车好 吗 ?
sentences.en: Let us hail a taxi, shall we?

sentences.cn: 备有家具的房间出租.
sentences.en: Furnished rooms to let.

sentences.cn: 涂脂抹粉的女人,等于?上了愿意把自己出租的招贴.
sentences.en: A woman that paint put up a bill that she is to let.

sentences.cn: 安徽省安庆市岳西县有没有店面出租?
sentences.en: If Anhui Province An Qing City Yue Xi County has shop front let out?

sentences.cn: 出售及出租美国康宝 [ 译音 ] 系列喷涂机.
sentences.en: The sale and letting of the United States combo [ transliterated ] series spraying machine.

sentences.cn: 我打电话是想问一下你在公报上登的广告一事,你想出租在Stotfold的房子.
sentences.en: I'm phoning about your ad in the Gazette for accommodation to let in Stotfold.

sentences.cn: 这房子要出租.
sentences.en: This house to let.

sentences.cn: 出租的房子在这里容易找到.
sentences.en: A house to let is easily to be found here.

sentences.cn: 此屋出租.
sentences.en: This house is to be let.

Sentence.sentence: She recalls:One day a man I worked with, Ryan, who had his office next to mine, said, Leah, let's go look at this space on Queen Anne .

Sentence.sentence: I was feeling so intentional and strong that I wasn't going to let fear just take over.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For most of us, letting go of the safety and security of the past gives us great fear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The man in the Google vehicle reported that he assumed the bus would slow down to let the car out, and so he did not switch to the manual mode.

Sentence.sentence: I am not talking about the quality of care, let me hastily add.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For comparison, let's say you wanted to jam a conversation between two people—all you'd need to do is yell in the listener's ear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: No one advocates letting someone convicted of pedophilia ( ' ,  恋童癖 ) work in a school.

Sentence.sentence: Let your sparring partners  ( ' , 拳击陪练 ) know how much you appreciate their contribution.

Sentence.sentence: I am not sure if she was more upset by my hubris ( ' ,  得意忘形 )  or by the fact that my English teacher had let my ego get so out of hand.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It's to let them be in control and to drive the car.

Sentence.sentence: No longer have we the inclination to let ourselves wander through fields of knowledge, ready to be surprised.
